Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
Resident E entered Resident J's room without staff's knowledge. Both girls have
hickeys on their necks. Staff 1 and 2 were not providing proper supervision.
INVESTIGATION:
Resident J, age 15, is a DHHS abuse/neglect ward in the Human Trafficking program.
She has resided in Beata Hall for seven months. I interviewed her by phone on 4/7/20
with the agency’s Rights Advisor present. Resident J said she and Resident E planned
to be alone together when an opportunity presented itself. She considers Resident E
her “girlfriend.”
Last week between 7 – 8 pm, Resident J asked to go to bed early. She said Resident E
was with the group in the general area and asked to use the bathroom. Instead of going
2

to the bathroom, Resident E entered Resident J’s room. Resident J said the girls kissed
and gave each other hickeys on the neck. “Resident E gave me oral,” she added.
Resident E stayed in Resident J’s room for approximately 10 minutes.
I asked Resident J what staff were supervising that night. She said Staff 1 and 2 were
supposed to be monitoring but they were not paying attention.
Resident E, age 17, is a DHHS abuse/neglect ward in the Cognitively Impaired
program. She has resided in Beata Hall for five months. She has a history of sexual
acting out at the facility.
I interviewed Resident E by phone on 4/7/20 with the agency’s Rights Advisor present.
She admitted she and Resident J had planned to be alone together. Last week,
Resident E said she walked out of the general area without Staff 1 and 2 noticing and
entered Resident J’s room. In the room, the girls gave each other hickeys and “I ate her
out.” Resident E told her therapist what she did, and Resident J was moved to a
different wing.
Rights Advisor 1 provided a photo taken on 4/7/20 showing what appeared to be the
remnants of a hickey on Resident E’s neck.
I interviewed Staff 1 by phone on 4/7/20 with the agency’s Rights Advisor present. He
has worked at the facility for two weeks. Staff 1 did not specifically recall a time when
Resident J went to her room early and Resident E asked to use the bathroom. He said
he did not see Resident E enter or exit Resident J’s room.
I interviewed Staff 2 by phone on 4/7/20 with the agency’s Rights Advisor present. She
has worked at the facility for two weeks. If Resident E entered Resident J’s room, Staff
2 said she was not aware of it. She said it may have happened when she was assisting
another staff handle the behaviors of her assigned one-to-one.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
3

ANALYSIS: During the first week of April 2020 Resident E entered Resident
J’s room without Staff 1 or 2 noticing. Both girls admitted this
was planned.
Inside of the room, Resident E and J said they engaged in
mutual and consensual sexual behavior. A photo of Resident
E’s neck showed what appeared to be the remnants of a hickey.
At the time of the incident, Staff 1 and 2 had only worked at the
facility for two weeks. A third staff person was present.
However she was assigned to monitor a resident one-to-one.
Staff 1 and 2 failed to provide adequate supervision of
Residents E and J.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
